description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
year the data point was obtained
month the data point was obtained
day of the month the data point was obtained
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/gorilla/orangutan
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the participants - usually numerical

trial type = Transfer– different (TD): The experimenter presented a pair of the identical clear cups filled with different amounts of grape juice (20 ml and 50 ml) and let the participant select one of the containers. The first choice was necessary to confirm that the apes were motivated to select the larger quantity. After the first choice the experimenter transferred the contents of the clear cups into a clear dish and a clear tube. The participant was then allowed to make a second choice and given the contents of the selected container/ No-transfer– different (NTD): The experimenter presented the two different amounts of juice (20 ml and 50 ml) directly in the pair of the dish and tube from the beginning of the trials so that the participant could see only the end result of the transformation of the quantities. After the first choice the selected quantity was immediately given to the participant./ Transfer–same (TS): This condition was the same as the TD condition but with equal juice quantities (50 ml)./ No-transfer–same (NTS): This condition was the same as the NTD condition but with equal juice quantities (50 ml)./ No testing trial (NO)

LD trial: In half of the trials the larger quantity was poured into the dish and the smaller quantity into the tube./ LT trial: in the other half the combination of the quantities and the shapes of the containers was reversed.
whether the participant pointed at both alternatives= The participant simultaneously sticks its fingers through both the right and left holes in the Plexiglas in the 1st choice.
whether the participant changed a choice (CC): The participant sticks its finger(s) through one of the holes in the Plexiglas and changes to the other hole in the 1st choice.
whether the participant pointed at both alternatives:  (PB): The participant simultaneously sticks its fingers through both the right and left holes in the Plexiglas in the 2nd choice.
whether the participant changed a choice (CC): The participant sticks its finger(s) through one of the holes in the Plexiglas and changes to the other hole in the 2nd choice.
whether the participant hesitated in the 1st choice: The participant demonstrated hesitant behavior by PB (pointing at both alternatives) or CC (changing a choice) in the 1st choice.
whether the participant hesitated in the 2nd choice: The participant demonstrated hesitant behavior by PB (pointing at both alternatives) or CC (changing a choice) in the 2nd choice.
